10.18.17  6:58 pm   I'm taking a piano class this year in college to brush up on skills, and one warmup drill made me realize how the first five notes of a scale played together sounds very appealing and interesting. Any thoughts why that is?

     i think that might sound a bit messy. but if you take out one of the notes in the middle i think it will sound worlds better

     just start with whatever you can find and you will gradually learn more tricks as you experiment more

10.18.17  4:40 pm   I never understood the circle of fifths
Also why is it fifths and fiths?

     i think if you look at keys, like the key of C, ..... then look at the key of G. you'll notice that the key of G uses exactly the same notes as the key of C but you only have to change one note. then if you look at the key of D (which is in the same relation from G as G was from C) you'll notice again that D contains almost exactly the same notes as G, but you just have to change one note. and so on. the next key in the same pattern would be A. again, you only have to change one note from the key of D to get the key of A. each time you're adding a sharp, and it's always in the same position relative to the new key (it's always the 7th degree). perhaps the circle of fifths seems a little more useful now. it goes the other way too, except instead of adding a sharp you are taking away a sharp, or if there's none left then a flat gets added

10.18.17  4:38 pm   This is actually serious
I really want to know how you get inspired you are SERIOUSLY creative and how

Lease don't ignore this is important

     a single square pixel

10.18.17  12:40 pm   are there any key signatures you will not touch, on principal? 

     well if it's more than 6 flats or sharps, i'd say probably just use the other one

10.18.17  12:40 pm   my battery is at 41%, reminding me to ask you what the "41" means in "song 41"

     it means the same thing as "51" in area 51, which if i am correct means "what the heck is going on in there"

10.18.17  12:04 pm   What does half-time/double-time mean? Like if you had 4 bars, each bar with a whole-note, what would happen if you switched to half-time? Double-time? Or does it only have to do with the drum beat and not the melody? 

     it's just a way of describing if something happens twice as fast or half as fast as something else. usually used to talk about drums, for example a common drumbeat would have the snare (or "backbeat") on beats 2 and 4. but then if you go "halftime" then the backbeat would be only on 3. the beat would be moving half as fast

10.18.17  12:01 pm   So, I've asked this for your past couple of songs... Can you tell me the first chord & melody note of the new upcoming tune?

     G and G

10.18.17  11:47 am   Do you have a good feel for tempo markings (in terms of bpm)?

     yes

     Like if I played a click track, and you were to guess the bpm, how close do you think you'd get? (Assuming the bpm is like normal song range and not something crazy).

     probably within 5

10.18.17  10:40 am   How/where can I learn music concepts? Stuff like notes, G minor, E, F, C, etc, just fly over my head

     if you find a piano keyboard i will tell you what the notes are

10.18.17  10:15 am   What's a good way to practice keeping an open mind?

     try opening it and closing it repeatedly

     sure

10.18.17  2:52 am   why is elevator music so bland

10.18.17  2:46 am   10.16.17  11:09 pm why not get the kind that has the long eraser that you can twist out as it wears down and replace when it runs out? even if you got a new one each time it would last a lot longer than one with a tiny unreplaceable nub. usually they come with extra erasers (and lead) in the pack. they cost more but it would probably end up the same or less as the amount of pencils you would go through in the same length of time. it likely makes little difference but maybe you might want to try and see if you like it

     i like my current brand so much there is no way you are going to get me to change. i buy large packs and they are all different colors. however, i haven't used any pencils in a long time because where i am it is currently the year 2017

10.18.17  1:48 am   what does the caps lock key do

     it makes all the letters capital

     and why do you hate it so

     i do not hate it, but i guess my question is why do you hate it
